results.definition: (physics) electromagnetic radiation that can produce a visual sensation
examples: the light was filtered through a soft glass window

results.definition: any device serving as a source of illumination
examples: he stopped the car and turned off the lights

results.definition: a particular perspective or aspect of a situation
examples: although he saw it in a different light, he still did not understand

results.definition: the quality of being luminous; emitting or reflecting light
examples: its luminosity is measured relative to that of our sun

results.definition: an illuminated area
examples: he stepped into the light

results.definition: a condition of spiritual awareness; divine illumination
examples: follow God's light

results.definition: the visual effect of illumination on objects or scenes as created in pictures
examples: he could paint the lightest light and the darkest dark

results.definition: a person regarded very fondly
examples: the light of my life

results.definition: having abundant light or illumination
examples: they played as long as it was light
as long as the lighting was good

results.definition: mental understanding as an enlightening experience
examples: he finally saw the light
can you shed light on this problem?

results.definition: merriment expressed by a brightness or gleam or animation of countenance
examples: he had a sparkle in his eye
there's a perpetual twinkle in his eyes

results.definition: public awareness
examples: it brought the scandal to light

results.definition: a divine presence believed by Quakers to enlighten and guide the soul
a visual warning signal
examples: they saw the light of the beacon
there was a light at every corner

results.definition: a device for lighting or igniting fuel or charges or fires
examples: do you have a light?

results.definition: make lighter or brighter
examples: This lamp lightens the room a bit

results.definition: begin to smoke
examples: After the meal, some of the diners lit up

results.definition: to come to rest, settle
examples: Misfortune lighted upon him

results.definition: cause to start burning; subject to fire or great heat
examples: Great heat can ignite almost any dry matter
Light a cigarette

results.definition: fall to somebody by assignment or lot
examples: The task fell to me
It fell to me to notify the parents of the victims

results.definition: alight from (a horse)
